title: Sona mains stop deluding yourselves
body:
"But other supports like Leona, Blitz, Thresh are just as oppressive!"

The other 3 have shorter range (2 of them melee) and all require on landing a skillshot to engage on you, not to mention they all lack sustain and don't have 5 million auras that require absolutely no skill to be useful

You mash buttons on sona and give your team hundreds of gold of stats just for picking sona, and you people actually genuinely believe that is a healthy game pattern. She's a broken champion that is not fun to fight against whatsoever because she has absolutely no counterplay in her kit. All of her damage is targetted in lane, she's ranged, she has auras, and she has sustain. Even Crescendo is so easy to land. 

You keep acusing right of having absolutely no idea how to fix Sona when in reality you're using it as some sort of sick denial tactic to cover up the fact that you play one of the easiest (if not THE easiest) champions in the entire game who has way more power than their risk should allow. Stop kidding yourselves

Everything you just said is wrong.

Her W is pretty strong for it's CD. It heals two targets and provides a shield. That's like saying Ashe's Ult does bad damage as a complaint. The heal isn't the entire ability, and it also charges her passive.

Also, Sona is hilariously easy. There is almost no skill involved, there isn't even a choice on her passive because 90% of the time you want Q

> [{quoted}](name=killd0zer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ol9uAd0s,comment-id=000800000000,timestamp=2015-01-16T01:59:06.625+0000)
> Her W is pretty strong for it's CD. It heals two targets and provides a shield.

Her heal is the weakest in the game actually. 30 at level 1. However it heals 2 people at once, so you could say it's 60. However, Taric's base heal is 60 for *both* him and his ally, and if used on himself then it's 84. Plus it scales off 30% of his AP (Sona's is 20%, 40% if you're counting both heals, but then Taric's would be 60%) plus 5% of his bonus HP.

Sona's heal becomes more powerful the lower HP the person is at, but it's not that big a boost. If she healed somebody at 0% HP she'd heal them for 45 HP at level 1.

As for the CD, Taric's is almost twice as long (8/7/6/5/4 seconds longer) but is twice as strong (at all levels) and costs the same (At level one, it becomes 10/20/30/40 mana more expensive at higher levels)

Soraka's heal is obviously much stronger, cheaper, and on a lower CD, buuuut it also costs HP so I'm not gonna get in to that.

As for Sona's shield it is also super weak, but as it's a bonus I can understand that. However it has a very small range to apply and lasts for a second and a half, which compared to other shields is really short. Plus the mana cost is huge considering her base mana.
> Also, Sona is hilariously easy.

She may be harder then you think. Not with her skills mind you, with the fact that her short range isn't about the support, but the ADC. Get in range to Q and most ADCs (Maybe not Graves) will be able to toss an AA or two and massively out damage you, considering how squishy Sona is.
You may say, "Well she'll just heal up anyways" and she would... If that wouldn't make her go OoM.
She can literally use W 3 times before going OoM at level 1. At level 2 she can use 3 W's, *and* a Q before going OoM.

My point is, I never saw Sonas dominating recently, yet she gets chain-nerfed to the point where most people seem to think she's not even that strong anymore, and then gets nerfed a few more times.

I think it'd make more sense to reposition her power instead of hitting it until it stops moving.

All three of those supports are tanky though. They can afford to overextend a little to land their shots. If Sona steps 2 inches away from minion cover, she's sharkbait. She has no defense, no escape, and her poke is mediocre unless you use both Hymn of Valor and Power Chord together. Her heal is cripplingly expensive early for jack shit of a return, and E is just as useless as it was when she was released.

Those three champions also have far better ults, dealing much larger damage, or operating at longer range, or cutting off bottle necks for long times. Sona drops a weak stun and prays she can waddle away before they stop dancing.

Blitz, Thresh, and Karma are more oppressive than Sona ever was, or probably ever will be.  And no, I don't play Sona, I just haven't seen a Sona do well bot lane more than once in a blue moon.  Most of the time they end up hiding under the turret with the adc because they're both squishy as hell and they ran into an actual oppressive sup.

There was valid reason she was (previously) the only champ with a difficulty rating of 1 - they slightly changed it, but she's still a yawnfest. 

I used to main support (Thresh and Braum, mostly) and owned every single support and secondary role supp, *except* Sona because she is extraordinarily simple to use.

Yeah, she only has two settings.
Pray
Die

I love how the people who disagree, had a downvote of what was obviously the guy who made this post, or a person who has no idea how to debate. I mean, if you are going to downvote somebody SAY WHY you down voted them. Also, Sona is in a terrible place right now. I just play her in norms if i really want to play her, hell she was all ready nerfed into the ground-not to mention Nami does a far better job at what Sona is suppose to do.

I'm no Sona main, but there are a whole lot of supports that are a lot more oppressive than Sona, not to mention champs in other lanes that oppress their own lanes much harder than Sona.

As a matter of fact, Sona was only oppressive in matchups that were favorable for her, and she apparently has a fair amount of bad matchups.

Sorry, but Riot clearly does not know what they are doing with Sona.

They added the Q on-hit, but nerfed Q active and Power Chord to compensate. "We want to shift power from passive auras to active abilities". And that'd be OK - except they nerfed the on-hit effect. And then the passive some more.

They absolutely ruined the W heal and upped the manacost to the heavens, but added a shield and a missing %HP scaling. "We want more clutch heals and less keeping herself and her lane mate topped off". And that'd be OK too - except they cut the %HP ratio IN HALF.

And they give a joke compensation with her ultimate raising the aura effectiveness. Wow, that +30 damage/ally lategame is going to help a lot. It doesn't even compensate for other nerfs.

SO, HER NEW "ACTIVE" SKILLS END UP LESS EFFECTIVE THAN OLD "PASSIVE ONES". Which means what they are doing to Sona is complete and utter FAIL, both from gameplay and aesthetics perspective.

And Leona, Blitz and Thresh might have to "land a skillshot", true. But, for example, Blitz's reward for doing so results in kill or burning a flash 90% of the time. Leona "landing a skillshot" results in your face being melted if she's paired with an early aggressive ADC. Thresh... don't even bring him up. He is a god of supports, bar none. Morg probably gets you killed, especially if she has her ult too. Mind that Leona and Blitz have double the Sona's pickrate and same or higher winrate.

Funfact: Nami literally does everything Sona does, but better.
Another fun fact: Leona and Thresh not only murder Sona by hitting one skillshot (but it's fair, right? because they have to "hit a skillshot") with Relic Shield heal more than Sona's W. And if Sona tries to use her heal more often than Shield charges are up, she goes OOM. So Thresh also does Sona's job better than her, with better engage/disengage to boot.
